8/14/2019.name: Transfer Parent Evening
8/14/2019.description:
Open to parents of transfer students in grades 10-12.



Parents of transfer students in grades 10-12 are invited to Transfer Parent Evening where they will learn all about Stevenson High School, from academics, to athletics, to resources. Bring your questions. If the student enrolls after this date, always feel free to contact the student's counselor with any questions.

8/16/2019.name: Freshman Mixer
8/16/2019.description:
Free lock-in event for ninth-graders. Drop-off and pick-up will only be available in parking lot E, by the Sports Center entrance. Use the Port Clinton Road entrance.



All ninth-grade students are invited to the annual Freshman Mixer on Friday, Aug. 16, sponsored by the Patriot Parent Association and Stevenson's Student Activities Division. The lock-in event runs from 7-9 p.m. The evening will feature a DJ, snacks and prizes. Admission is free for freshmen who show their Stevenson ID. Drop-off and pick-up will only be available in parking lot E, by the Sports Center entrance. Use the Port Clinton Road entrance for easiest access. Want to volunteer at the Freshman Mixer? Contact Yulee Lee ( yuleelee@gmail.com ) or Robin Babbo ( robinbabbo@gmail.com ).

8/17/2019.name: Football Team Corn Roast Fundraiser
8/17/2019.description:
Enjoy fresh roasted corn from Didier Farms while supporting Patriot football.



The football program will hold its annual corn roast fundraiser from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Saturday and Sunday at Sunset Foods, 4190 Illinois Route 83 (at the corner of 83 and Aptakisic Road) in Long Grove. Fresh roasted corn from Didier Farms will be available.

8/18/2019.name: Football Team Corn Roast Fundraiser

8/20/2019.name: Transfer Student Resource Fair
8/20/2019.description:
Breakfast will be served



At this event, transfer students meet with various groups at the school, including co-curricular coordinators, intramural coordinators, and the leaders of SPINS (Stevenson Patriots In New Situations). SPINS is a social group for transfer students who meet throughout the school year to go bowling, play whirlyball and other activities. SPINS is free of charge, except for stopping for food. Whenever a student enrolls, he/she is invited to join SPINS.

8/21/2019.name: Parent Open House Night #1
8/21/2019.description:
The first of two parent open house nights, this evening is intended for families whose student has a last name beginning with the letters A-L. However, anyone may attend either open house night.


2019 Open House Nights  
  
    Wednesday, Aug. 21 / Last Names A-L / 7-9:30 p.m.
  Thursday, Aug. 29 / Last Names M-Z / 7-9:30 p.m.  
  
    Have a schedule conflict on one of the nights? No problem! Attend on the other date
    
  Each year, Stevenson High School holds Open House evenings for parents. These evenings provide faculty and staff with the opportunity to meet parents of SHS students, inform them about the curriculum in the courses their children are taking, and showcasing many of the resources offered to students and families.
  
  During Open House,  parents will visit each of their student's classrooms and meet their child's teachers . All parents received a letter from the school that includes a blank schedule for the evening, listing the times for each class period. Parents should have their students fill in his/her courses, room numbers, and teachers' names prior to attending Open House. Parents may also choose to print their student's schedule   through Infinite Campus . Parents should bring this schedule with them. 
  
     Parents of freshmen and transfer students  also will have the opportunity to hear from their counselor from 6:15-6:45 p.m. Counselors will discuss their roles and answer questions. Each student's counselor is listed on the schedule distributed during orientation in August. The counselor also may be found through Infinite Campus. Counselor locations are listed below.
                                           West Building                                     East Building                             
                          Amy Grove                 Room 2900                  Griffin Dwyer                  Room 7052           
                          Mary Jones/Jennifer Falk                 Room 2818                  Ray Tad-y                 Room 7054           
                          Sarah Kellogg                 Room 2628                  Patty Martin                 Room 7058           
                          Megan Kelly                 Room 2630                   Lisa Scanio                 Room 7060           
                          Irina Kogan                 Room 2624                  Carol Seeger                 Room 7062           
                          Lindsay Perkins                 Room 2622
              
                                Terese Sullivan

8/26/2019.name: Fall Play Ticket Sales Begin
8/26/2019.description:
Tickets for the fall play, "The Transition of Doodle Pequeño," go on sale Monday, Aug. 26.  Tickets are available online  and at the Patriot Superstore.










The play will be performed at 7 p.m. Thursday, Sept. 12, 4:15 and 7 p.m. Friday, Sept. 13, and 2 and 7 p.m. Saturday, Sept. 14. All performances will be held in the Black Box Theater, by the Sports Center entrance.


Tickets are $6. All tickets are general admission.  Click here to purchase tickets online . For those purchasing tickets at the Superstore, Patriot Dollars, checks, cash and credit cards (not Discover) will be accepted for payment. The Superstore is open one-half hour before school begins and during the lunch periods on school days.

8/26/2019.name: College Night for Senior Families
8/26/2019.description:
Open to all parents and guardians of seniors at SHS



The College Career Center will hold its annual Senior Parent Night from 7-8:30 p.m. Monday, Aug. 26, in the Performing Arts Center. The event is free and open to all parents and guardians of seniors at Stevenson.

During the presentation, postsecondary counselors Sara English and Sarah Kellogg will discuss how to apply to colleges. Topics to be covered include types of applications (Common App, for example), admission plans (including Early Decision), deadlines, obtaining a transcript, standardized test scores, letters of recommendation, essays and scholarships. The presentation will be using a web-based program called Peardeck, so families are encouraged to bring their SHS iPads or an electronic device connected to a Gmail address.

There will be a special session for parents and guardians of students with IEP/504 plans from 6:30-6:50 p.m. in Room 6110 of the new East Building addition.

9/5/2019.name: Children's Play Audition Workshop
9/5/2019.description:
Get prepared for next week's auditions



The audition workshop for the Stevenson Foundation's fall children's play, "Corduroy," will be held from 3:45-5 p.m. Thursday, Sept. 5 in the West Auditorium. The workshop will be an opportunity for students to meet the director, Laura Wesslund, play theatre games, learn more about the play, and ask questions about the auditions. Auditions for the play take place from 3:45-5 p.m. Tuesday and Wednesday, Sept. 10 and 11 in the West Auditorium. Come prepared with a monologue on Sept. 10. Visit  www.d125.org/auditions  for the audition sign-up form and audition packet. The play will be performed at noon and 2 p.m. Sunday, Oct. 27.

9/6/2019.name: Night of Champions
9/6/2019.description:
Honoring team and individual champions from the 2018-19 school year.



The Stevenson High School Athletic Department will recognize team and individual division, conference, Lake County, regional, sectional and state champions from the 2018-19 school year at its ninth annual Night of Champions event prior to the home football game against Neuqua Valley on Friday, Sept. 6.

Athletes on the teams listed below are asked to check in with their ID at the east or west admission gates to receive complimentary admission to the game. The schedule for the evening is as follows:

4:30 p.m. - Gates open for admission
5 p.m. - JV football game vs. Neuqua Valley
6:45 p.m. - Organization of procession for teams/individuals in the southeast corner of the Stadium. Honored athletes will receive their "Night of Champions" T-shirt at this time.
7 p.m. - Night of Champions procession
7:30 p.m. - Varsity football game vs. Neuqua Valley

The following teams and individuals will be honored:

9/7/2019.name: Streetfest
9/7/2019.description:
The annual Streetfest will benefit three local charities: KIDSS for Kids, Kan-Win, and Turning The Page.  Read more about Streetfest. 



The National Honor Society's annual Streetfest charity fundraiser will be held from 6-9 p.m. Saturday, Sept. 7 in parking lot E at Stevenson. Admission is $10.
    
This year's theme is "Making Magic in the Community." Food trucks, games and entertainment will be part of the evening, which benefits three Chicago-area charities:
    
 K.I.D.S.S. for Kids:  This organization, whose name stands for Kindness Is Doing Something Special For Kids, raises money for the Department of Family Services programs at Ann and Robert H. Lurie Children's Hospital of Chicago to address the emotional, social and spiritual needs of hospitalized children and their families. These programs include art therapy, recreation, tutoring, preparation for medical procedures, family resources, culturally appropriate care, pastoral care, bereavement counseling and much more. Learn more about K.I.D.S.S. for Kids at  http://kidssforkids.org .
    
 KAN-WIN:  This group's mission is to eradicate all forms of violence against women, including domestic violence and sexual assault, by empowering Asian-American survivors and engaging the community through culturally competent services, community education and outreach, and advocacy. KAN-WIN's services are designed to empower immigrant survivors to tackle the unique and complex challenges they face and transition from crisis to long-term empowerment. Through intensive wrap around services, KAN-WIN strives to provide a one-stop shop for survivors to minimize the risk of chasing for help. Learn more about KAN-WIN at  www.kanwin.org .
    
 Turning the Page:  This non-profit links public schools, families and communities to ensure students receive valuable educational resources and a high-quality public education. Turning the Page, founded in Washington D.C. in 1998, features Carpe Librum ("seize the book") pop-up book stores that sell gently used books, CDs, DVDs, and records, with the profits supporting the program's initiatives. In 2015, Turning the Page expanded its operations to Chicago's North Lawndale neighborhood. Learn more about Turning the Page at  https://turningthepage.org .

9/9/2019.name: Homecoming Dance Ticket Sales Begin
9/9/2019.description:
Early bird pricing Sept. 9-10 only. Ticket sales end at 3:30 p.m. Sept. 20.  Details 



Homecoming Dance ticket sales begin Monday, Sept. 9. Ticket prices are:
       	* Early bird ticket pricing ($20) is in effect Sept. 9-10.
  	* Regular ticket sales ($25) will end at 3:30 p.m. Friday, Sept. 20.
  	* Tickets at the door ($40) are available to SHS students only.
       
Tickets can be purchased here:
   https://www.eventbrite.com/e/stevenson-homecoming-dance-2019-tickets-70273336441 
    
Students must use their Stevenson email address as the access code.
    
 Information on Non-SHS Students as Guests 
  Tickets for non-Stevenson students are $25, and can only be purchased by completing this form:
    
 https://signnow.com/s/xOLEC756?form=true 
    
The form will be open before Sept. 9. Non-SHS student ticket sales will end Wednesday, Sept. 18. Tickets will not be sold at the door to non-SHS students.
    
Before completing the form, students will need email addresses for the following:
       	* Their parent/guardian
  	* Their dean at Stevenson
  	* Their guest's parent/guardian
  	* Their guest's dean (if the guest is in high school)
       
All form information will be digital and will be emailed to the individuals listed, so email address accuracy is vital. Once students have received notification that their form has been approved, they will have the option to purchase a Non-SHS Homecoming Dance ticket.
    
The theme of this year's Homecoming is "UP." For more information,  visit the Homecoming page .

9/12/2019.name: "Not My Kid?!!"
9/12/2019.description:
Stress, vaping and other realities of teenage life will be addressed.



Stress, vaping and other realities of teenage life will be addressed during the annual "Not My Kid?!!" presentation at 7 p.m. Thursday, Sept. 12 in the West Auditorium. The event is free and open to the public, but registration is requested by Sept. 11  through this link . "Not My Kid?!!" is sponsored by  Catalyst , a student club, and the  Stand Strong Coalition .

A panel of experts will delve into topics relevant to parenting teenagers. Among the topics are these:
 * The teen brain, and why teens act the way they do
* Helping teens deal with stress
* Understanding what teens are exposed to in terms of vaping, alcohol and marijuana
* Details on the new marijuana laws and how they will impact teens
* Helping teens navigate social situations such as Homecoming and after-parties
* Information on social hosting laws and local curfew rules
 
In addition, there will be a mock teen bedroom offering parents possible indicators of teen drug/alcohol use and showing popular hiding places for teens. The mock bedroom will be open until 9 p.m.

Panelists scheduled for the evening include:
 * Lake County State's Attorney Mike Nerheim
* Dr. Susan Sirota, a local pediatrician and assistant professor at Northwestern University's Feinberg School of Medicine
* Principal Troy Gobble
* Substance Abuse Prevention Coordinator Dr. Cristina Cortesi
* Officer Bethany Brown, a Lincolnshire police officer and one of Stevenson's school resource officers
* A family member impacted by alcohol and drug use
* A current drug-free SHS senior.

9/18/2019.name: CPN Presents: LIKE Movie and Discussion
9/18/2019.description:
Join the Community Parent Network to watch and discuss LIKE, a documentary that explores the impact of social media on our lives.

 





LIKE is  a documentary exploring the impact of social media  on our lives and the effects of technology on the brain. The film's goal is to help people, especially students, take control of their social media use, create balance in their lives, and become more caring toward one another. Event sponsored by the Community Parent Network, a program of the Stevenson Foundation. Free admission.

9/19/2019.name: ARTalk with Jill King
9/19/2019.description:
Open to the public




Visiting Artist of the Month Jill King will discuss her work and her career during the first ARTalks presentation of the 2019-20 school year. ARTalks is sponsored by the Stevenson High School Foundation and the SHS Fine Arts Division. This year's theme is "Celebrating Women Artists." To see more of her work, visit  www.jillkingstudio.com . 

The Visiting Artist Gallery is located on the first floor of the West Building, just south of the Forum (point) entrance. Use parking lot B for easiest access. ARTalks are free and open to the public.  Learn more about ARTalks and Stevenson's Visiting Artist of the Month program .

9/27/2019.name: Foundation Event: Catapult
9/27/2019.description:
An America's Got Talent finalist from Season 8, Catapult is a magical production that features incredible dancers who work behind a screen to create shadow silhouettes of shapes from the world around us. Be amazed as you watch their bodies transform into a mountain, an elephant, a dragon, even a helicopter! You'll never figure out how they do it, and you won't know what they will create next -- you'll be surprised and delighted again and again.

Tickets are $20 per person.  Click here to purchase tickets .

All tickets will be waiting at will-call the evening of the performance.
Seating is assigned on a first-come, first-serve basis.

  

Groups of ten (10) or more are eligible to receive a 10% discount. 
Please call Ashley Bunzol at  847-415-4472  to learn more.

10/17/2019.description:
Dr. Michele Borba, author of "Unselfie," will examine how to raise caring, successful kids in a plugged-in, trophy-driven world. Free.



The  Community Parent Network , a program of the Stevenson Foundation, sponsors "An Evening With "Unselfie" Author Michele Borba." Parents are grappling with technology- and digitally-driven challenges that no previous generation has faced. Borba will offer proven strategies to help parents raise successful, happy, compassionate and socially responsible children in a hyper-competitive society.

11/15/2019.name: Musical: Chicago (High School Edition)
11/15/2019.description: "Chicago: High School Edition" is a toned-down version of the satirical take on corruption in Chicago during the Jazz Age of the 1920s. Based on a script by Fred Ebb, Bob Fosse, John Kander and Maurine Dallas Watkins, Chicago is the longest-running American musical in Broadway history. Its film adaptation won the Academy Award for Best Picture in 2002.

11/16/2019.name: Musical: Chicago (High School Edition)
11/16/2019.description: "Chicago: High School Edition" is a toned-down version of the satirical take on corruption in Chicago during the Jazz Age of the 1920s. Based on a script by Fred Ebb, Bob Fosse, John Kander and Maurine Dallas Watkins, Chicago is the longest-running American musical in Broadway history. Its film adaptation won the Academy Award for Best Picture in 2002.

1/23/2020.name: Incoming Freshman Course Selection Evening Night #1

1/25/2020.name: Foundation Event: Happy Together
1/25/2020.description: Married musical stars Michael and Angela Ingersoll hilariously share the spotlight singing oldies but goodies. He's the beloved star from  Jersey Boys  (original San Francisco, Los Angeles, and Chicago casts) and the PBS retro-rock group Under the Streetlamp. She's the Emmy nominee known for her astonishing portrayals of Judy Garland ( End of the Rainbow ;  Get Happy  on PBS). Enjoy Chicago Tribune's "Dynamic Power Couple" for shenanigans and signature songs including "Save the Last Dance For Me," "Over the Rainbow," and "I've Had the Time of My Life."

1/28/2020.name: Incoming Freshman Course Selection Evening Night #2

1/30/2020.name: Freshman-Sophomore Play: Puffs
1/30/2020.description: The freshman-sophomore play features the Harry Potter parody, "Puffs, Or: Seven Increasingly Eventful Years at a Certain School of Magic and Magic," by Matt Cox. "For seven years a certain boy wizard went to a certain Wizard School and conquered evil. This, however, is not his story," reads the play's website. "This is the story of the Puffs ... who just happened to be there too. A tale for anyone who has never been destined to save the world."

2/6/2020.name: CPN Presents: Mindfulness for Parents
2/6/2020.description: The Community Parent Network, a program of the Stevenson Foundation, sponsors "Mindfulness for Parents." Mindfulness, or being present in the moment, is necessary in parenting. Join Ramaa Krishnan to learn how to slow down, and give space for some "being" instead of always "doing."

2/13/2020.name: ARTalk with Nadine Royster
2/13/2020.description:
Open to the public



Visiting Artist of the Month Nadine Royster will discuss her work and her career during the fourth ARTalks presentation of the 2019-20 school year. ARTalks is sponsored by the Stevenson High School Foundation and the SHS Fine Arts Division. This year's theme is "Celebrating Women Artists." To see more of her work, visit  www.yadiart.com .

The Visiting Artist Gallery is located on the first floor of the West Building, just south of the Forum (point) entrance. Use parking lot B for easiest access. ARTalks are free and open to the public.  Learn more about ARTalks and Stevenson's Visiting Artist of the Month program .
